entry.value: Metanode to create input data for interactive UpSet using UpSet plot application (https://caleydo.org/tools/upset/). UpSet plot application needs to be located e.g. in KNIME workspace, please check the path in the metanode settings (default is "gitfolders/KNIME_metanodes/Applications/UpSet/" folder inside your KNIME workspace).%%00010%%00010Metanode creates binary matrix (1 or 0) from the provided data columns and the specified threshold and operator - each value from the data columns is compared with the threshold using the given operator and 1 is returned if the condition is true (e.g. 10 > 1), otherwise 0 is returned (e.g. 0.5 > 1).%%00010%%00010You can also specify multiple metacolumns of different data types (e.g. string type) for annotation and summaries of individual row categories based on the binary matrix.%%00010%%00010Binary matrix with potential metacolumns is then exported by the metanode into the UpSet application ("data/knime_data" subfolder) and datasets.json file is modified to enable newly created file to be viewed in UpSet application. The metanode then starts the simple python webserver inside the UpSet application folder and opens browser with the UpSet page after the data preparation.%%00010%%00010The metanode will be shown as still running to indicate that the webserver is running from that concrete metanode. You can cancel the metanode or close the workflow with the running metanode to stop the webserver.%%00010%%00010Please see the application documentation (https://caleydo.org/tools/upset/) for more details on its usage and features explanation.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010UpSet application (https://caleydo.org/tools/upset/) (The UpSet application consists of the following MIT license. Licence terms are available here: https://github.com/VCG/upset/blob/master/LICENSE)%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3 (The Python consists of the following Python 3.6 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3.6/license.html)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 3.7.2 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 3.7.2a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 0.2.0 from 2019-11-18%%00010Contact person: David Potesil (david.potesil@ceitec.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes
Outer workflow does not have input data, execute it first
